ygData.subject: RE: Charming Methods
ygData.msgSnippet: You should think yourself lucky, I have got base Cha 85 and I have a -18 hit due to my Staff of Writhing and Grotesque Mask, I am currently saving for a
ygData.messageBody:
You should think yourself lucky, I have got base Cha 85 and I have a -18
hit due to my Staff of Writhing and Grotesque Mask, I am currently saving
for a Platinum Star Ruby Veil (+9Dex/Cha) but they are so expensive and
it's hard to find people that can make them!!
I was a bit dissappointed with the stats on the Lambent Vambraces, +1 Cha
doesn't really make alot of difference, they should of made it +3/4 just to
make it that little bit better.
Does anyone know the stats for the Lambent Boots??

Madagan




"JasonF" <JasonF@...> on 11/11/99 19:11:22

Please respond to eqbards@onelist.com

To: eqbards@onelist.com
cc: (bcc: John Senior/M&G)
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Charming Methods




From: "JasonF" <JasonF@...>

My CHA is around 105 with standard equipment on, another 15 if I use my
Crude Stein.

It has become apparent in reviewing the last couple of posts in this thread
that I'm either not coordinated enough to pull this off or I just need more
practice. I'll try and hit the Orc Cents again and give it another go, but
hell, if I can't even finish off two Orcs without losing half a bubble of
health, how am I going to fare with Froon and Choon?

Charming Griffs or HGs is simply laughable to me. I would die so damn
fast...

> Your Int is 75 - what is your Charisma?
>
> From posts I've seen - Charisma is the overriding factor when it comes to
> the charm line of things.

Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to toren@...
with the subject lol.
